data.meta_site_name: Saku valla Jaapani sõprade klubi / Saku Parish Japanese friends club / サク教区日本友達クラブ
data.text:
Jaapani Saku linna ja Eesti Saku valla koostöösuhete ajalugu

1998

Suhted Jaapani Saku ja Eesti Saku omavalitsuse vahel said alguse 1990. aastate lõpus, kui Jaapani kaubandus- ja tööstusminister külastas Tallinnat ning märkas, et Eestis on müügil Jaapani linna nimeline õlu Saku. Samal perioodil märkasid Jaapani Sakut asukohana Eesti Saatkond Jaapanis saatkonnaliikmed Jōshin-etsu ekspressliinil (Expressway).

2004

Alustati läbirääkimisi kahe omavalitsuse vahelise sõpruslepingu allakirjutamiseks.

2007

1. mail 2007. aastal jõuti koostöölepingu sõlmimiseni.

Lepingus sätestatati: mõlemad omavalitsused edendavad koostööd mitmetes valdkondades nagu haridus-, kultuuri- ja majandusvaldkonnas; mõlemad omavalitsused jagavad infot, et arendada paremat avalikku haldust; mõlemad omavalitsused toetavad oma elanike vastastikusi külastusi, et sõprussidemeid veelgi tugevdada.

Jaapani keiser ja keisrinna külastasid 2007. aastal laulupidu koos Saku valla esindusega. Keisri vastuvõtuks korraldatud pidulikul vastuvõtul osalesid ka Saku vallavolikogu esimees ja Saku vallavanem.

2009

Jaapani Saku delegatsioon osales laulu- ja tantsupeol ka aastal 2009, marssides koos Eesti Saku tantsijate ja lauljatega rongkäigus.

2010

Jaapani suursaadik Hideaki Hoshi koos abikaasaga külastas Sakut 2010. aastal. Sellest ajast on tihedad sidemed Saku vallavalitsuse ja Jaapani saatkonna vahel. Jaapani saatkond on toetanud meie õpetajaid ja ametnikke, pakkudes neile koolitusi Jaapanis.

2011

Jaapani Sakus on loodud Eesti-Jaapani sõrussuhete ühing, et tihendada sõprussuhteid kahe omavalitsuse vahel veelgi. Selle liikmed on külastanud mitu korda ka Eesti Sakut. Eesti ametlik delegatsioon külastas Jaapani Sakut 2011. aastal.

2012

2012. aastal tähistati sõpruslepingu sõlmimise 5. aastapäeva. Maikuus külastas Jaapani Saku delegatsioon Eesti Sakut.

2014

Alates 2014. aastast toimub oktoobri lõpus või novembri alguses Saku valla hallatavates asutustes jaapani nädal, kus tutvustatakse vallaelanikele jaapani kultuuri

2016

2016. aasta 16. jaanuaril sõlmisid Eesti Saku ja Jaapani Saku õpilasvahetuslepingu.

2016. aasta oktoobris toimus esimene õpilasvahetus – Saku valla 7 õpilast ja 2 õpetajat külastasid Jaapani Sakut. Sama aasta augustis tulid jaapani õpilased vastukülaskäigule Eestisse. 2017. aasta oktoobris käisid taas Saku valla õpilased Jaapanis Saku linnas.

2019

1. mail 2019 sõlmisid Jaapani Saku linn ja Eesti Saku vald sõprussidemete tugevdamise lepingu niinimetatud sister-city lepingu, millega viiakse omavahelised sõprussuhted kõrgemale tasemele. Allkirjastamine toimus Jaapani riigi jaoks märgilise tähtsusega ajaloolisel hetkel – uue keisri ametisse astumise esimesel päeval, reiwa ajastu alguses.Tseremoonial rõhutas Eesti suursaadik Jaapanis Väino Reinart, et Saku vallast on kujunenud Eesti ja Jaapani vahelistes suhetes vaieldamatu teenäitaja. Senine sõprussuhe on keskendunud valdavalt Eesti ja Jaapani õpilasvahetusele, mis on esimene taoline õpilasvahetus Jaapani Saku linna ja Euroopa Liidu liikmesriigi vahel. 2016. aastast alates on igal aastal külastanud Jaapani õpilased Saku valda ja Saku õpilased Jaapanit. Edaspidi laiendatakse tegevusi kultuuri, hariduse ja majanduse valdkondades. Kahe Saku koostöö tulemusena valmistuvad Eesti judokoondis ja Eesti kergejõustikukoondis Saku linnas vastavalt 2019. aasta judo MM-iks ja 2020. aasta suvel toimuvateks Tokyo olümpiamängudeks.

2. juulil 2019 loodi ametlikult Eesti Saku valla Jaapani sõprade klubi. 17 asutajaliiget panid aluse sõprusklubile mille eesmärgiks on aidata kaasa Eesti Saku valla ja Jaapani Saku linna koostöö arendamisele.

2.-8. juulil viibis 15-liikmeline Jaapani delegatsioon Eestis. Nädala jooksul osaleti tantsu- ja laulupeol, külastati erinevaid vaatamisväärsusi, koole, raamatukogusid. Toimus kohtumine Eesti Olümpiakomiteega ning sõlmiti leping Eesti sportlaste ettevalmistuseks Jaapanis Saku linnas. Delegatsioon kohtus Eesti Presidendi Kersti Kaljulaiuga,

History of Exchanges between Japanese Saku City and Estonian Saku Municipality

Heisei 10 (1998)

September: When a city of “Saku” in Japan that is the same name “Saku” in Republic of Estonia was found, an exchange between two cities started. （Mr.Marelk Luts, the First Secretrary of Estonian Embassy in Japan, found a sign of “Saku Intercange on Joshin-Etsu Expressway.)

Heisei 11 (1999)

February: Mr.Miura, the Mayor of Japanese Saku City, and Mr. Takano, the chairperson of Saku Board of Education, were invited to a reception of Declaration of Independence.

April: Mr.Mark Sinisoo, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Estonian Embassy in Japan, visited Japanese Saku City.

Heisei 13 (2001)

October: Japanese Saku City invited Mr. Peeter Miller, the Chargé d’Affaires ad interim of Estonian Embassy in Japan, to 40th anniversary of Old Saku City.

Heisei 15 (2003)

May: Japanese Saku City invited Mr.Argo Kangro, the Chargé d’Affaires ad interim of Estonian Embassy in Japan, to Saku Balloon Festival.

Heisei 16 (2004)

July: A citizens’ group of Japanese Saku City visited Estonian Saku City, bringing a message of Mr. Miura, the Mayor of Japanese Saku City. (Saku Estonia Association was founded from this visit.)

November: Mr. Arnold Rüütel, the president of Republic of Estonia, and his wife visited Japan. Estonian Embassy in Japan invited Mr. Miura, the Mayor of Japanese Saku City.

Heisei 17 (2005)

February: 14 Estonian athletes of Special Olympics Nagano stayed with families of Japanese Saku City.

June: A citizens’ group of Japanese Saku City visited Estonian Saku City, bringing a message of Mr. Miura, the Mayor of Japanese Saku City. (Second visit)

July: Ms. Timo stayed with families of Japanese Saku City.（For 1 month）

July: Saku Lions Club sent Ms. Sakurai Yuka, a student of North Nozawa High School, to stay with an Estonian family.

August: Japanese Saku City invited Mr. Sven Kesler, the Mayor of Estonian Saku City, the chairperson of the city council, 7 members of the city council and Mr. Argo Kangro, the Chargé d’Affaires ad interim of Estonian Embassy in Japan, to a ceremony of the birth of New Saku City.

Heisei 18 (2006)

May: Japanese Saku City invited Mr.Argo Kangro, the Chargé d’Affaires ad interim of Estonian Embassy in Japan, to Saku Balloon Festival.

July: Mr.Miura, the Mayor of Japanese Saku City, and Mr. Kikuhara, the chairperson of Saku City Council, officially visited Estonian Saku City.

July: Sõprus, Estonian folk dance group, performed at Saku Cosmo Hall. (550 visitors)

October: Mr. Miura, the Mayor of Japanese Saku City, visited Mr. Peeter Miller, new Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Estonian Embassy in Japan.

Heisei 19 (2007)

1 May: Signing a Friendship City Agreement Signing Ceremony was held at Japanese Saku City Hall. The chairperson of Estonian Saku Municipal Council, the Mayor of Estonian Saku City and Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Estonian Embassy in Japan were present at the ceremony. 1 May:

29 June ～ 6 July: Mr.Miura, the Mayor of Japanese Saku City, and Mr. Kikuhara, the chairperson of Saku City Council, officially visited Estonian Saku City.,

Heisei 23 (2011)

3 ～5 May: A delegation of Estonian Saku City, including the Mayor, visited Saku Balloon Festival for the first time.

Heisei 24 (2012)

2 ～3 May: Mr. Toivo Tasa, Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Estonian Embassy in Japan, visited Saku Balloon Festival.

9 ～ 16 May: A delegation of Japanese Saku City visited Estonian Saku City for celebration of 5th anniversary of signing the friendship city agreement. (Mr. Koike, the Deputy Mayor, Mr. Nakazawa, the chairperson of Saku City Council and 10 citizens.)

4 ～ 26 August: Japanese Saku City invited Mr. Veikko Montonen, the First Secretrary of Estonian Embassy in Japan, to an opening ceremony. The festival was held in “Oginoya”. We offered Estonian foods, sold beer made in SAKU beer and displayed pictures of Estonia.

Heisei 25 (2013)

18 Oct. Mr. Kai Tetsuro, Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Embassy of Japan in Estonia, visited Japanese Saku City.

Heisei 26 (2014)

8 Feb. Mr. Hanaoka, a president of Japan and Estonia Association of Friendship, and a manager of Tourism and Exchange Promotion Section of Japanese Saku City participated in the retirement ceremony of Mr. Baruto, a sumo wrestler from Estonia and former ozeki.

6 Oct. As International Youth Exchange Program, a Estoian youth visited Japanese Saku City.

9 Nov. Kokorono-Musical’ “Koitora”, that is set in Estonian Saku City, was performed at Saku Cosmo Hall. A number of audience was 1400 people. And Mr. Jaak Lensment, the Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Estonian Embassy in Japan, appreciated it.

Heisei 27 (2015)

2 ～ 5 May. A delegation of Estonian Saku City, including the Mayor and the chairperson of city council, visited Saku Balloon Festival. They were present at the opening ceremony, talked about an exchange training program for children, and visited various places.

21 ～ 23 Nov. A delegation of Estonian Saku City, including the Mayor and school officials, visited Japanese Saku City. They had a consultation about the exchange training program for children between two Saku Cities.

Heisei 28 (2016)

13～19 Jan. A delegation of Japanese Saku City, including the Mayor and the chairperson of city council, officially visited Estonian Saku City. They were present at 150 anniversary ceremony of a foundation of Estonian Saku City, signed an agreement of the exchamge training program fo children, and visited Embassy of Japan in Estonia. And they also visited Estonian Athletic Association and Swedish Atheletics Association for inviting a training camps of Olympics.

3 ～ 5 May. Mr. Kai Tetsuro, Ex Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Embassy of Japan in Estonia, was present at the festival and a dinner party.

24 ～ 31 Oct. Children of Estonian Saku City visited Japanese Saku City for the first time. They deepened friendship with Japanese Saku City, through stay with Japanese families and experience of Japanese junior high school.

16 Nov. As a Host Town Exchanges Project, Mr. Baruto, the former sumo wrestling ozeki, was designated as “Ambasador of Friendship Exchanges in Saku”. And Mr. Kai Tetsuro, Ex Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Embassy of Japan in Estonia, designated as “Advisor of Exchanges with Republic of Estonia”.

Heisei 29 (2017)

3 Feb. Ms. Yanagisawa Yoko, the Ambassador of Embassy of Japan in Estonia, visited Japanese Saku City. And she paid a courtesy visit to the Mayor of Japanese Saku City.

14 Feb. Mr. Yanagida, the Mayor of Japanese Saku City, was invited to a party of Declaration of Independence, hosted by Estonian Embassy in Japan.

22 Apr. Estonian minister of Agriculture and Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Estonian Embassy in Japan visited “Goryokaku” and “Sakugoi (carps) Farm”.

3 ～ 5 May. As a celebration for 10th anniversary of signing the friendship agreement, a delegation of Estonian Saku City (including the Mayor), Mr.Argo Kangro, a counselor of Estonian Embassy in Japan, and Mr. Kai Tetsuro were present at the Festival.

3 ～ 5 May. Mr. Baruto,”Ambasador of Friendship Exchanges in Saku”, participated in Saku Balloon Festival and “Sakugoi” marathon.

29 Jul. ～ 5 Aug. Junior high school students of Japanese Saku City visited Estonian Saku City for the first time. They stayed with Estonian families and exchanged with Estonian children.

31 Jul. Mr. Martti Raju, a Deputy Secretary- General of Estonian Olympic Committee, and Mr. Argo Kangro visited Saku General Sports Park Athletic Field and accomodations.

23 ～ 31 Oct. Estonian children exchanged with junior high shool students of Japanese Saku City and stayed with Japanese families.

25 Oct. Ms. Tuulikki Bartosik, an Estonian performer of accordion, played at Civic Hall of Saku Municipality. (200 citizens)

27 Oct. Estonian cooking class was held by Estonians who lived in Japan. And we exchanged with a Estonian who had won at Japanese speech contest in Estonia.

Heisei 30 (2018)

24 Feb. ～ 2 Mar. We sold Estonian foods at local supermrkets. Also we held “Estonia Festival”, where Mr. Baruto, Mr Argo Kangro and Mr. Kai Testsuro were present. (Talk Show and Tourism Presentation, etc)

26 Feb. The Mayor of Japanese Saku City received a letter, signed by the Mayor of Estonian Saku City and the chairperson of city council, from Ms. Abe Akie(wife of the prime minister) at an official residence of the prime minister.

3 ～ 5 May. Mr.Jaak Lensment,Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Estonian Embassy in Japan, Mr. Argo Kangro and Mr.Baruto were present at the Festival.

17 ～ 24 May. As a celebration for 10th anniversary of concluding Friendship-City Agreement with Estonian Saku City, Japanese Saku City visited Estonia at 100th anniversary of Estonian Declaration of Independence. We deepened our friendship through face-to-face exchange. And Japanese Saku City recommended Estonian Team to hold a pregames training camp for the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games in Saku City, Japan.

30 Jul. ～ 6 Aug. Junior high school student of Japanese Saku City visited Estonian Saku City. They stayed with Estonian families and exchanged with Estonian children.

19 ～ 22 Aug. Estonian Radio Girls Choir exchanges with choir of junior hihg school, visited elementary school and have lunch at there. They held mini-concert and had exchanges. They also toured in the city such as a factory of Citizen.

15 Sep. Japan & Estonia Association of Friendship and citizens of Japanese Saku City cleaned up around Sakudaira Station.

16 Sep. Estonian National Male Choir held a performance at Saku Cosmo Hall. And they also sold Estonian honey and sundry goods.

10 Oct. “Estonian Music Festival” was held at Sakudaira Community Center. And “Estonian Design Day”, when works of Estonian designers were displayed and sold, was also held.

19 ～ 25 Oct. Children of Estonian Saku City visited Japanese Saku City. They stayed with Japanese families and exchanged with Japanese junir high school students.

10 ～ 13 Nov. Ms. Sirje Lippe, a Secretary-General of Estonian Athletic Association, and Ms. Kristel Berendsen, a Sport Director of the same Association, visited Japanese Saku CIty. They visited athletic facilities such as Saku General Sports Park Athletic Field. And they also visited municipal elementary school and exchanged with children.

Heisei 31 (2019)

9 Mar. ～14 Apr. Japanese Saku City held a special exhibition “A tiny treasure box in Northern Europe, Estonia – Ancient Estonia expressed by Kaljo Pollu – at Saku Municipal Museum of Modern Art.

Reiwa 1 (2019)

1 May. Signing a Sister-City Agreement Signing Ceremony was held at Assembly Hall of Japanese Saku City. Mr. Tiit Vahenõmm, the chairperson of Estonian Saku Municipal Council, Mr. Marti Rehemaa, the Mayor of Estonian Saku City, and Mr. Väino Reinart, Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of Estonian Embassy in Japan, were present at the ceremony.

On 2.-8 July, a Delegation Led by the Mayor of the Saku City Mr. Seiji Yanagida Visited Estonia, a delegation led by the the Mayor of the Saku City (Nagano Prefecture, Japan) Mr. Seiji Yanagida visited Estonia to celebrate the sister city relations between Saku City in Japan and Saku Municipality in Estonia. A 15-member delegation included also Chairman of the City Council Mr. Tadashi Kozu and President of the Saku Sister and Friendship Cities Association Mr. Masayuki Sasaki. During the visit, Mr. Yanagida met with the Mayor of the Saku Municipality Mr. Marti Rehemaa and the Chairman of the Rural Municipality Council Mr. Tiit Vahenõmm along with other members of the Council and also with those affiliated with the sister cities to deepen the friendship between the two cities, and also paid a courtesy call to the President of Estonia H.E. Mrs. Kersti Kaljulaid. The delegation took advantage of an opportunity to attend the Estonian Song and Dance Celebration. In addition, the Mayor Mr. Yanagida and Vice President of Estonian Olympic Committee Mr. Tõnu Tõniste signed the agreement, which states that Saku City in Japan will be the host of the training camp for Estonian sportsmen before the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020. In order to enhance exchanges between Japan and Estonia, Chargé d’Affaires a.i. of Japan Mr. Hajime Matsumura availed himself of that opportunity to host a reception at the Japanese Ambassador’s residence, by inviting Estonia-Japan parliamentary group, friendship associations of both countries, sports organizations such as Estonian Olympic Committee etc., governmental organization, and contributed to forming networks among various organizations that are promoting friendly relations between Japan and Estonia.
